meanings.definition: A feudal lord in medieval France
meanings.sent1: The vidame oversaw the lands and peasants in the medieval village.
meanings.sent2: The vidame inherited his title from his ancestors in France.
meanings.sent3: The vidame tried to ride a horse in his medieval attire, causing laughter among the villagers.
meanings.sent4: The vidame's authority in the village was as strong as the stone walls of the castle.
meanings.sent5: The image of the vidame in his grand castle was etched in the minds of the villagers.

meanings.definition: A title of nobility in France
meanings.sent1: The king bestowed the title of vidame upon the loyal nobleman.
meanings.sent2: The vidame's title granted him privileges and respect in the royal court.
meanings.sent3: The young nobleman proudly introduced himself as the vidame of his family.
meanings.sent4: The title of vidame shone brightly among the other noble titles like a rare gem.
meanings.sent5: The elegance and prestige of the vidame's title captivated all who met him.

meanings.definition: A person holding the title of vidame
meanings.sent1: The vidame attended the royal banquet in his finest attire.
meanings.sent2: As a vidame, he was expected to uphold the honor and traditions of his title.
meanings.sent3: The vidame accidentally spilled his drink on the king, causing a moment of chaos.
meanings.sent4: Among the nobles, the vidame stood out like a rare flower in a field.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the vidame at the event added an air of sophistication and grandeur.
